explains: n. 神秘；神秘主义；谬论

sentences.en: As a younger man Harrison was intrigued by Indian mysticism.
sentences.cn: 哈里森年轻时被印度神秘主义迷住了。

sentences.en: Those devout traders, called "Wali Ullah" or "those close to God", energetically spread both trade and religion by adapting their appeals tothe native mysticism of Java.
sentences.cn: 这些虔诚的商人，叫做“Wali Ullah”，或者“接近主的人”，把他们的祈求呼吁跟爪哇当地的神秘主义相结合，通过这一途径积极热情地拓展商业买卖和宗教信仰。

sentences.en: Stace distinguished two types of mystical experience, namely extrovertive and introvertive mysticism.
sentences.cn: 斯泰斯区分了两种神秘体验，即外向型和内向型神秘主义。
